# Troubleshooting

## Pictures are mottled.

| Problem | Solution |
|---------|----------|
| Shutter speed is slow and the ambient temperature is high: | This is normal and does not indicate a malfunction. Use pixel mapping (ðŸ“– 117). *X-rays, cosmic rays, and other forms of radiation interacting with the image sensor may cause bright spots of various colors such as white, red, and blue. Pixel mapping helps reduce the occurrence of such bright spots. |
| The camera has been used continuously at high temperatures: | Turn the camera off and wait for it to cool down (ðŸ“– 35, 327). |
| A temperature warning is displayed: | Turn the camera off and wait for it to cool down (ðŸ“– 35, 327). |
